any-hover.description: Does any available input mechanism allow the user to hover over elements?

any-pointer.description: Is any available input mechanism a pointing device, and if so, how accurate is it?

aspect-ratio.description: Width-to-height aspect ratio of the viewport

color.description: Number of bits per color component of the output device, or zero if the device isn't color

color-gamut.description: Approximate range of colors that are supported by the user agent and output device

color-index.description: Number of entries in the output device's color lookup table, or zero if the device does not use such a table

display-mode.description: The display mode of the application, as specified in the web app manifest's display member

dynamic-range.description: Test the combination of brightness, contrast ratio, and color depth that are supported by the user agent and the output device.

grid.description: Does the device use a grid or bitmap screen? [0 = bitmap; 1 = grid]

forced-colors.description: Detect whether user agent restricts color palette

hover.description: Does the primary input mechanism allow the user to hover over elements?

inverted-colors.description: Is the user agent or underlying OS inverting colors?

monochrome.description: Bits per pixel in the output device's monochrome frame buffer, or zero if the device isn't monochrome

overflow-block.description: How does the output device handle content that overflows the viewport along the block axis?

overflow-inline.description: Can content that overflows the viewport along the inline axis be scrolled?

pointer.description: Is the primary input mechanism a pointing device, and if so, how accurate is it?

prefers-color-scheme.description: Detect if the user prefers a light or dark color scheme

prefers-contrast.description: Detects if the user has requested the system increase or decrease the amount of contrast between adjacent colors

prefers-reduced-motion.description: The user prefers less motion on the page

resolution.description: Pixel density of the output device

scan.description: Scanning process of the output device

scripting.description: Detects whether scripting (i.e. JavaScript) is available

update.description: How frequently the output device can modify the appearance of content

width.description: Width of the viewport including width of scrollbar

video-dynamic-range.description: Test the combination of brightness, contrast ratio, and color depth that are supported by the user agent and the output device.
